data: Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the powerplan (NOT required for direct admit patients)
Provide patient with a bandana, per (CF) - Infection Prevention and Control Guidelines for patients with CF (IC.06.01)
q12h, Respiratory rate, blood pressure, heart rate, pain assessment, temperature
q4h, Respiratory rate, blood pressure, heart rate, pain assessment, temperature
T;N, for 48 hour, AM Fasting, 2 hours after dinner for 48 hours, then reassess
T;N, for 72 hour, QID before food and bedtime for 72 hours, then reassess
Insert Intravenous by Venous Access Team
Routine, Insert Extended Peripheral IV Catheter
Patient may go on pass following IV medications and afternoon physiotherapy sessions
If patient receiving amnioglycosides, urine output monitoring required
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
Therapeutic Diet: High Protein High Calorie
Calculate Pediatric Maintenance Fluids based on 4-2-1 Rule

10 mL/h,IV, drug form: bag [Greater Than or Equal To 50 kg]

10 mL/h,IV, drug form: bag [Greater Than or Equal To 50 kg]
IV, May heparin-lock central line between medications with Heparin 10 units/mL
Obtain AIR flowmeter and use MEDICAL AIR outlet for nebulized medications. Do not use oxygen flowmeter or outlet unless otherwise specified
